basics.name: Jai Veilleux
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: A graduate student studying Quantum Information Science at the University of Southern California

work.name: The University of Vermont
work.position: Teaching Assistant - CS3240 Algorithm Design & Analysis
work.summary: Grading undergraduate programming and written homework assignments and answering questions about homework and course material.

work.name: Brookhaven National Lab
work.summary: Month long program developing scientific computing skills relating to quantum computing, including translating problem statements into quantum circuits.

work.name: Airship AI
work.summary: Performed root cause analysis of issues on Windows servers. Resolved issues and wrote clear documentation for customers and contractors. Developed automation solutions, reducing/eliminating user input and time spent on repetitive tasks. Proposed and implemented Git server for version control of IT department scripts and programs. Updated and organized outdated internal knowledge base.

work.name: The IT Support Center, LLC.
work.summary: Resolved customers technology problems in a prompt, professional manner. Researched and developed solutions to unique problems as they arose. Operated in a remote-first environment, supporting users internationally and at home.

volunteer.summary: Qiskit Advocates contribute to the development of quantum computing education and research, utilizing Qiskit as a platform for hands-on learning and experimentation.

certificates.name: Co-Design Center for Quantum Advantage Quantum Computing Summer School

projects.name: SamplableSet (Rust)
projects.summary: Fast weighted sampling using a composition-rejection scheme and dyadic grouping. Rust re-implementation of my professors original C++ code. Includes optional Python and C/CXX bindings.

projects.name: qpgf
projects.summary: Python implementation of my method to analyze the distribution of errors in a quantum circuit given hardware error rates using probability generating functions.

projects.name: Pine DNS
projects.summary: A DNS server capable of handling a variety of record types, using external resolvers, and recursively resolving queries.

projects.name: Rusted Rogue
projects.summary: An ASCII roguelike game written in Rust
